If this mean temperature function is integrated over radius and suitably scaled, the result can be interpreted as a cumulative probability distribution for the sill location radius (Supplementary Fig. 6b). In practice, we used area rather than radius for the horizontal coordinate and subtracted the position of the plume head marker (taken as the location of maximum temperature anomaly) in order to form a cumulative probability function for the sill location area anomaly δA′ for each sill (Supplementary Fig. 6d). This function was used as a look-up table to determine the sill location radius from the appropriate random number for each new sill.
